FuncDef:
The sender command creates a TWAMP Light Session-Sender and displays the TWAMP Light Session-Sender view. If the Session-Sender specified in the sender command has been created, the command displays the Session-Sender view.
The undo sender command deletes the TWAMP Light Session-Sender.
By default, no TWAMP Light Session-Sender is created.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To start a TWAMP Light statistical service, run the sender command to create a TWAMP Light Session-Sender.
Precautions
A TWAMP Light session must be created on the Control-Client where TWAMP Light statistics are to be collected.After a Session-Sender is deleted, only proactive measurement is stopped. On-demand measurement automatically stops after required statistics are collected.To configure TWAMP Light, you must configure the Responder and then the Controller. If only the Controller is configured, the Responder sends a large number of TWAMP Light packets received from the Controller to the LDM, and responds to the Controller with a large number of ICMP packets.
